Information From the Restaurant Offers
Description: Taqueria La Mexicana is a Mexican , Tex-mex , and Chinese restaurant where most Menuism users came for a meal on the go and paid less than $10 . Tags: Mexican, Online Ordering, Dinner, Good for groups, Good For Kids, Tex-mex, Chinese, Asian, Authentic Mexican Affordable, and Best Of Boston Stats: 4 dishes entered by diners at Taqueria La Mexicana 1 user wants to eat at Taqueria La Mexicana 2 users love Taqueria La Mexicana Tips: The restaurant is said to serve some of the best tamales in the New England area.
Nothing yet.

Add as friend Send Msg
Taqueria La Mexicana jimbaab March 29, 2008 5.0 5.0 star rating +3 2 +3 3 Votes Same favorite place - now with frills!
I’ve been eating lunch at“La Taqueria,”almost daily, for three years now. The myth will now be legend.
Taqueria La Mexicana has expanded both its space and its menu. This favorite local“hole in the wall”for authentic“cheap eats”now includes a higher-end dinner menu and a full bar.
You can still order your favorite foods and juice from the“taqueria”end of the space, but, now you can enjoy them in the vibrant new restaurant and cantina space, with 99 other people ordering margaritas and beers to wash down their tasty dish.
Dishes I tried:
Pork Taco Plate
5.0 star rating
Comes with rice and refried beans. This is one of my favorite dishes. Put a little hot sauce on each taco and wash it down with a mango juice. Link To Review

Add as friend Send Msg Taqueria La Mexicana foodisgood August 23, 2007 5.0 5.0 star rating +1 0 +1 1 Votes This is a no-frills kind of place with really great, chea...
This is a no-frills kind of place with really great, cheap Mexican food. As far as I can tell, the tortilla shells are homemade, which already is enough to set this place WAY above most Mexican places I’ve been to in Boston. Link To Review

Fresh Food and Juice, Affordable, Casual
We just got back from this place in Union Sq. and will definately be back soon! The food was made right there, fresh ingredients and was VERY tasty! I had the tamale plate (4.50) an a pork taco (2.00) and my boyfriend had a small burro…

September 29, 2005
5 star rating
Great for Catering!
Roberto catered a party for us for 60 with fabulous food. He helped us choose the menu and made some off-menu veggies for us when we requested that. The chicken mole was a big hit. The food was delicious and plentiful. The price could…
read full review» buddy88bea from Citysearch
September 16, 2005
5 star rating
Wow
Excellent Mexican food and right in the neighborhood. Not great seating or ambience, but its so cheap it's probably cheaper to eat here than cook for yourself. The people who work there are so nice and the food is simply delicious.…
